title: Bug 3622 - New Package Wizard has confusing message
description: The New Package Wizard displays a confusing message when the package name field is empty.
OB: When invoking the New Java Package option, the following message appears at the top before typing anything: 'A folder corresponding to the package name already exists'. The package name field is empty at this point.
EB: When invoking the New Java Package option with an empty package name field, no message should be displayed. If this message is intended as a warning, it should be displayed in a way that clearly indicates it is a warning, such as using red color and the error icon.
SR:
1. Open the New Java Package wizard.
2. Leave the package name field empty.
3. Verify that no message is displayed.
4. Verify that the finish button is disabled.
